title: System Prompt Agent
description: Schema for system prompt agent definitions in the library

agentname.description: The display name of the agent/assistant.

api_notes.description: Free-text notes on API usage, dependencies, or quirks.

audio.description: Indicates if audio input is required.

autonomous.description: Marks if the agent operates autonomously without supervision.

better_as_tool.description: Marks if this is better suited as a tool rather than a standalone agent.

character.description: Indicates whether the agent assumes a specific character/persona.

chatgpt_access_url.description: Direct link to the deployed ChatGPT agent.

conversational.description: Indicates if the agent supports multi-turn conversations.

cost_estimates.description: Notes or figures on estimated operating costs.

data_utility.description: Marks relevance to data processing/utility use cases.

deep_research.description: Indicates if the agent is designed for deep research tasks.

description.description: Text description of the agent’s purpose and behavior.

external_tooling.description: Marks if external tools are mandatory for function.

file_input.description: Indicates if file input support is required.

guardrails_notes.description: Free-text notes describing safety rules or refusal logic.

image_generation.description: Marks if image generation is part of the workflow.

instructional.description: Indicates if designed for teaching or step-by-step guidance.

is_agent.description: Marks if this is a true agent (tool-using, stateful).

json_schema.description: Full JSON schema definition for structured output.

llm_selection_notes.description: Notes on which LLMs are most suitable.

local_llm_friendly?.description: Indicates suitability for running on local LLMs.

local_llm_notes.description: Notes about performance or quirks on local LLMs.

localtisation_notes.description: Notes about localization or language support.

mcp_notes.description: Notes related to Model Context Protocol integrations.

mcps_used.description: List of Model Context Protocol components/tools used.

pii_notes.description: Notes on handling personally identifiable information.

rag.description: Marks if retrieval-augmented generation is required.

single_turn.description: Marks if designed for single-turn interactions.

spech-to-speech.description: Indicates if speech-to-speech interaction is supported.

structured_output.description: Marks if structured output is produced.

tts.description: Indicates if text-to-speech output is required.

update_iteration.description: Marks if an update or iteration cycle occurred.

use_case_outline.description: Free-text outline of supported use cases.

utility_estimate.description: Numerical or qualitative estimate of usefulness.

video_input.description: Marks if video input is required.

vision.description: Indicates if vision input is required.

voice_first.description: Marks if designed primarily for voice-first use.

writing_assistant.description: Indicates if designed as a writing assistant.
